title: `--Xnetwork-safe-slots-to-import-optimistically` can't be set to value lower than 128
body:
### Description

Test `syncing-with-chain-having-valid-transition-block` of branch https://github.com/marioevz/hive/tree/all-tests-plus-cl-clients starts two execution client nodes with two different PoW chains that reach the same Total Difficulty on the same height on different blocks, so the test expects the beacon node to only sync to the other node after the `SAFE_SLOTS_TO_IMPORT_OPTIMISTICALLY` slots period has passed.

Test  is currently passing when the default `SAFE_SLOTS_TO_IMPORT_OPTIMISTICALLY` value (128) is used. However when the value is reduced (see https://github.com/marioevz/hive/blob/4cc5298565e85f5babe96c34f16131a4ff8f8ddb/simulators/eth2/engine/scenarios.go#L54) to e.g. 16, the test waits 16 + 4 slots after the merge and then fails because the beacon node does not re-org.

The `SAFE_SLOTS_TO_IMPORT_OPTIMISTICALLY` value is also written to `config.yaml` file before start, see https://github.com/ethereum/hive/pull/605.

If a value higher than 128 is used, the test behaves as expected and passes, therefore this issue only affects the runtime of the hive optimistic sync test cases, it's not a breaking issue.

Also worth mentioning is that the chain has _not_ finalized before the 128 slots in this short-lived hive test net.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
To reproduce, grab hive branch https://github.com/marioevz/hive/tree/all-tests-plus-cl-clients, modify https://github.com/marioevz/hive/blob/4cc5298565e85f5babe96c34f16131a4ff8f8ddb/simulators/eth2/engine/scenarios.go#L54 value to any value less than 128 (16 was used during testing) and run command:

```
hive --client go-ethereum,teku-bn,teku-vc --sim eth2/engine --sim.limit "/syncing-with-chain-having-valid-transition-block"
```

**Expected behavior:**

Teku should re-org to the alternate valid chain after 16 slots.

**Actual behavior:**

Teku still waits 128 slots to re-org.

**Frequency:**

Every time when the test case is run.

### Versions
* Software version: teku/v22.6.1+66-g02d6064/linux-x86_64/-eclipseadoptium-openjdk64bitservervm-java-17
* Java version: openjdk 17.0.3 2022-04-19
* OS Name & Version: Ubuntu 18.04.6 LTS
* Docker Version: Docker version 20.10.17, build 100c701
From what I've looked at previously I *think* this was actually because we only kept retrying execution for 2 slots so it should be fixed by https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/pull/5941

Tried to run these tests but I'm getting failures from hive without much info:
```
./hive --client go-ethereum,teku-bn,teku-vc --sim eth2/engine --sim.limit "/syncing-with-chain-having-valid-transition-block" -loglevel 5
DBUG[07-19|11:16:19] docker daemon online                     version=20.10.13
INFO[07-19|11:16:19] building image                           image=hive/hiveproxy nocache=false pull=false
INFO[07-19|11:16:19] building 3 clients...
INFO[07-19|11:16:19] building image                           image=hive/clients/go-ethereum:latest dir=clients/go-ethereum nocache=false pull=false
INFO[07-19|11:16:20] building image                           image=hive/clients/teku-bn:latest dir=clients/teku-bn nocache=false pull=false
INFO[07-19|11:16:20] building image                           image=hive/clients/teku-vc:latest dir=clients/teku-vc nocache=false pull=false
INFO[07-19|11:16:20] building 1 simulators...
INFO[07-19|11:16:20] building image                           image=hive/simulators/eth2/engine:latest dir=simulators/eth2/engine nocache=false pull=false
EROR[07-19|11:16:34] image build failed                       image=hive/simulators/eth2/engine:latest err="The command '/bin/sh -c go build -o ./sim .' returned a non-zero code: 2"
The command '/bin/sh -c go build -o ./sim .' returned a non-zero code: 2
```

I pushed a new version of https://github.com/marioevz/hive/tree/all-tests-plus-cl-clients.

Could you try doing `docker build .` directly in the `./hive/simulators/eth2/engine` folder to see if this gives more information about the error?


Got hive working and confirmed this test is passing with the latest teku thanks to the execution retry improvements.
